content.title: Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Kit Yojana
content.department: Department of Women Empowerment and Child Development
content.details: Launched by the Department of Women Empowerment and Child Development in Uttarakhand, the 'Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Kit Yojana' is a social security scheme offering a helping hand to new mothers and their daughters. This initiative specifically targets mothers with a family income below a certain limit. By providing essential nutritional kits, the program aims to improve the health and well-being of both mothers and their newborn daughters during the crucial postpartum period. These kits aren't just filled with good food; they also contain necessary items to ensure proper care for both the mother and child. Ultimately, the Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Kit Yojana aspires to not only support the health of mothers and daughters but also potentially bridge the nutritional gap and promote gender equality.
benefits: For Mothers: Dry fruits, socks, scarp towels, shawls, blankets, bedsheets, sanitary pads, mustard oil, soap, nail cutters etc.
For the girl child: Cotton/warm cap, sock, loincloth, towel, baby soap, rubber sheet, warm blanket, vaccination card etc.
eligibility: Beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
Beneficiary should be a postpartum woman.
Beneficiary should not be an income tax payer.
Beneficiary should be registered in any Anganwadi centre.
Beneficiary should be the first or second daughter of her mother.
content.application_process: Offline. Step-1: Concerned parents should visit their nearest Anganwadi Centre. Step-2: Provide all the necessary documents as directed (attested, if required). Step-3: After the completion of the procedure benefits can be availed from the Anganwadi Centre.
documents_required: For Mother: Medical proof of being a postpartum woman.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Kit Yojana is a social security scheme by the Department of Women Empowerment and Child Development, Government of Uttarakhand, that aims to provide nutritional kits to the postpartum mothers and their daughters.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme has been launched by the Department of Women Empowerment and Child Development, Government of Uttarakhand.

faqs.question: Who are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Postpartum women and their daughters are the targeted beneficiaries under this scheme.

faqs.question: What kind of assistance can be availed through this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme provides nutritional kits to the mothers and their daughters.

faqs.question: What should be the age criteria for the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: There is no specific age criteria for the beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How can the benefits be availed?
faqs.answer: Concerned parents should visit their nearest Anganwadi Centre with all the necessary documents as directed.

faqs.question: What benefits are provided to the mothers?
faqs.answer: For Mothers: Dry fruits, socks, scarp towels, shawls, blankets, bedsheets, sanitary pads, mustard oil, soap, nail cutters etc.

faqs.question: What benefits are provided to the girl child?
faqs.answer: For the girl child: Cotton/warm cap, sock, loincloth, towel, baby soap, rubber sheet, warm blanket, vaccination card etc.

faqs.question: How many girl child will be cover under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only Two girl child will be cover under the scheme.

faqs.question: What documents are required to get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: For Mother: Medical proof of being a postpartum woman. Identity proof. For Daughter: Proof of birth.
